source: Louisiana State University Fact Book 2025, LSU Research Newsroom, LSU Athletics Media Guide

highlights.title: Flagship Location
highlights.body: LSU's main campus spans 1,000+ acres along the Mississippi River in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

highlights.title: Enrollment & Community
highlights.body: More than 37,000 students representing all 64 Louisiana parishes and 100+ countries.

highlights.title: Research Status
highlights.body: LSU is Louisiana's only public Tier 1 (R1) research university with $400M+ in annual research expenditures.

highlights.title: Signature Programs
highlights.body: Strengths in energy systems, coastal science, digital media, cybersecurity, and AI (LSU's Stephenson Department of Entrepreneurship & Information Systems).

highlights.title: Athletics
highlights.body: LSU Tigers compete in the SEC with 51 team national titles and 100+ individual NCAA champions; Tiger Stadium is nicknamed Death Valley.

faqs.question: What does LSU stand for?
faqs.answer: Louisiana State University and Agricultural & Mechanical College.

faqs.question: When was LSU founded?
faqs.answer: LSU traces its roots to 1853 and has been the state's flagship since the Morrill Act era.

faqs.question: What are LSU's colors and mascot?
faqs.answer: Official colors are Purple and Gold; the live mascot is Mike the Tiger (Mike VII).

faqs.question: Does LSU have AI programs?
faqs.answer: Yes. LSU's AI stack includes the LSU Center for Computation & Technology, Stephenson Department of Entrepreneurship & Information Systems, and a new AI & Data Analytics minor launched in 2025.

faqs.question: How successful is LSU football?
faqs.answer: LSU Football claims four national championships (1958, 2003, 2007, 2019) and plays home games at Tiger Stadium with capacity of 102,321.

stats.ranking_ai: Top 20 public AI talent pipeline in the Gulf South

events.title: Spring 2026 Priority Registration
events.details: Final day to register without late fee for 2nd 8-week session.

events.title: Bayou AI Summit
events.details: LSU Center for Computation & Technology hosts researchers on responsible AI for energy and coast.
